ratings.comment: The whole class was very dense and complicated at times. He would brush over certain things that are harder to grasp, but also hold onto concepts throughout the entire semester even when they didn't connect to new learnings (like assessments on old material that wasn't elaborated too specifically).

Overall, not a bad course for a 3 week, 3 credit winter break class. All of the lectures are pre-recorded, but there is A LOT of material to cover. Some of the grading guidelines were a little fuzzy, but I enjoyed the material. If you're considering the class, try to find it outside of a condensed timeline!

English 319 - took this over winter break, LOTS of reading and assignments, open note exams, paper reflections after each module, long final exam. But - this class was condensed into only 3 weeks for 3 credits so honestly worth the struggle to earn a quick 3 credits and fulfill either a science or ethnic studies requirement!

Single-handedly the worst professor I had across 4 years. Lectures are worthless and required; the textbook's homework is confusing and graded like you should already know everything on day one of class. Purnell is condescending and laughs at student questions when it's his own lack of clarity that makes everything senseless. Do anything to avoid.

I never rate professors on here but feel so strongly about Prof Purnell and ENGL214 that I felt the need to share. I do not recommend this class. Prof Purnell is confusing, somewhat belittling, and too harsh for a 200-level introductory course. The TAs are awful and never give a clear, correct answer. HW takes forever and is so hard.

I expected this class to be a lot of work, but not FOUR HOURS OF LECTURE/READINGS EVERY TWO DAYS PLUS HOMEWORK EVERY SINGLE DAY, INCLUDING WEEKENDS AND MEMORIAL DAY. Good luck working ahead and getting off weekends. He also over-explains assignments and concepts until they don't make sense anymore. It's not that serious man, reduce the workload.

Do not take his classes over the summer. Very lecture heavy and yet all the lectures are awful and confusing. He makes you watch hours of these lectures every single day of the summer course (the longest being 220 minutes long), even on weekends. Grades all his assignments very hard and yet gives very vague and confusing instructions.

This course and professor weren't for me. The homework assignments were vague yet harshly graded, and lectures were unengaging and disorganized. However, exam questions seemed very fair. Do the readings, go to discussion, and you will be fine.

I took ENGL319 with Tom and loved it. So imagine my disappointment when this class turned out to be probably the worst class I've taken at UW. Lectures were interesting but not super relevant to class material at all. TAs were beyond incompetent, homework was useless and stupid, and I even though I was working hard in class, I learned nothing.

This class was a complete and utter waste of time and money. I would be better off teaching myself, in fact, I basically did. The lectures were unhelpful, but interesting, at their best, and completely useless at their worst (which was most of the time). The homework was also stupid, and somehow less helpful than the lectures.

The homework problems and the book are the only useful ways to pass the class. His lectures sometimes got off topic and didn't coincide with the exam questions. He also was just generally unhelpful outside of class.

Took this for my bio sci breadth & for that it was great! The lectures and readings aren't always super relevant, but it's not required, and the weekly hw & paper are pretty easy. The scope of the course is kinda vague, so you do have to read/come to class enough to get the gist, but I learned a lot about sociolinguistics.

I took the asynchronous online 4 week course, while it was hard because of the 4-weeks I think he did a good job. He was really flexible and would answer questions and was very nice about deadlines. He seems passionate. This course could be a little dry I have no idea what it would be like in a semester but I feel like he was a decent human being.

He clearly has a lot of knowledge to share but isn't very good at sharing. His lectures are long-winded and unclear. His instructions on assignments have typos and don't make much sense. He is willing to answer questions but his answers are never very helpful. He frequently disagrees with the textbook that he assigned.
Tom is really one of my favorite professors. I would take all of his courses if I could!

A bit of a difficult class, with heavy lectures and difficult materials for a linguistics course. But he's a great guy and will talk you through it, make sure you understand what you're doing and such. If you want to learn linguistics, he's a great pick for a professor; otherwise, you might want to pass if you're just looking around for an A.

This class seems like an interesting blend of topics, but Professor Purnell didn't really teach it well. His lectures were all over the place and were incredibly hard to follow. But overall the course required little comprehension with no exams or huge homework assignments aside from weekly discussion posts and a final paper on whatever you want.

1. Bad online asynchronous course 2. DO NOT TAKE THIS IN SUMMER. So the instructions are confusing and I lost points just because his instructions are near impossible. In the summer, he takes 14 weeks and puts it in 4. IT IS IMPOSSIBLE. Do not do it. There are due dates every single days. Even on holidays.

Wonderful, kind professor that's totally out of touch with how much his students know. Makes jumps in logic without explanation (at the expense of student comprehension). Tom cares a lot and is VERY passionate, but assumes because the smartest student understands, everyone else must too. I don't think he's ever answered one of my questions.

Tom is a good guy and a good professor. His classes are the kind where you get out of them what you put into them. The grading is not horribly tough the final project is important, but so long as you talk with him and plan it out you should be fine for the class. He's kind and knowledgeable. Would recommend.
Awful, just awful. Recites his political opinions as if they are inherent knowledge. Worst class I have taken at UW. Never again

Maybe it was just the fact that I was taking the class online, but I had a very difficult time with this professor. His questions and assignments were designed in frustrating ways, with typos and unclear wording galore. I think he's the kind of professor who wants students to ask about his questions, because if you don't, you likely won't get an A.
I really enjoyed this class, and I hope to take another class with him again.

There are no exams in this class! You NEED to stay up to date with the material because there is a lot of busy work every week. In the beginning of the class there is group work which was frustrating. Tom is very willing to give extensions as long as you ask but sometimes expectations can be confusing for assignments. He responds quickly to emails!

His lectures, quizzes, homework, and exams are straight out of the book. Biggest waste of time and money at this university so far. Do yourself a favor and just buy the recommended textbook. He also made us watch a 20 minute video about how to use Canvas.

I took his class and it was a struggle, not because it was hard but because his lectures made me want to fall asleep and it took all my willpower not to. He makes a mess at the board and sometimes leaves things hanging. He's a good guy, but not a good enough teacher for me to voluntarily take another one of his courses. Be prepared for boredom.

He was one of my favorite professors. He knows his stuff and holds interesting discussion and topics to talk about regarding the topic of race and language. He focuses on how we interpretthe information rather than memorization of information.

Tom was my fav professor. He knew his stuffs well and he was patient in answering students' questions. He was very easy going, humble and he held an objective manner in lectures and stuffs pretty much all the time. I truly wish he could take more rest as he seemed a bit too busy and tired around the end of the semester.
Great class

Purnell is a really awesome professor. His lectures were easy to follow, but if you don't attend the class they will not make sure. He is helpful in explaining content, if you don't understand a topic. The books that he assigned weren't necessary to pass the course. Overall, the class was interesting and enjoyable because of Purnell.

316 with Tom was a pleasure. I'm not sure what others are talking about. He is one of the most accomplished researchers at UW, and he shares his expertise in a really accessible way. Great instructor. You don't have to work too hard to learn a lot, but you can't slack on the assignments (HW, and your take home "quiz" midterm & final). Recommended.
I did really enjoy his class and learned a lot there.

He is really a nice guy who are willing to answer your email and help you out. The class will take your a lot of time figuring out computer software and the goal is a little unclear. But the grading is fair and not curved.

I expected to find sociolinguistics really interesting but ended up finding this course tedious and not engaging. The textbook and readings shoulder most of the blame as they were pretty dry. Lectures and instruction was average. Homework and take-home exams were sometimes somewhat vague, but overall fair.

Nice guy, but not a clear lecuturer. He was all over the board. Normally I would have just referred to the text book, but he would always talk about how the book was wrong. The expectations of what we were supposed to be learning were vague. I managed, but it could have been a lot better.

While at sometimes taking a while to get to the point, Tom is typically setting something up with an immense, if sometimes not immediately necessary, background for the student to get a broader context for the problem.  Great guy, and really wants to help you.  Sort through necessary and unnecessary and you're golden.

Tom is a really great guy, though his lecture style takes some getting used to.  I had two classes with him in one semester and found that he's really excellent with the material, but just can  explain it better one-on-one.  Fair grader and doesn't throw curveballs for tests.

This professor is an amazing guy and he really knows his stuff.  He will spend endless time going over material with you outside of class because he really cares about the material and the students.  He definitely knows his stuff, and he really wants his students to succeed.  Very reasonable tests and expectations...overall, excellent :)

I really regret taking this class. His lecture notes are unclear but he is very knowledgeable about what he teachers. He is a nice guy but I rarely went to lecture because I didn't get much out of it. Only one of the TAs were helpful..

Thomas annoys me to no end.  He clearly knows what he is talking about and is probably a very good linguist, but he is not a good teacher at all! I got nothing out of lectures and eventually stopped going. Discussions helped me out more than he did.
Absolutely horrid. Takes more effort to stay awake than learn class material. Boredom not worth the easy A.
AVOID THIS PROFESSOR AT ALL COSTS!! It's ironic that he is a linguistics professor and doesn't even COMPLETE HIS SENTENCES during lecture! If it wasn't for the TAs I'd be doomed in this course!
Very nice, but soooooooooooo bad at explaining things in Linguistics. I think he really knows his stuff, but he's not good at conveying it to a class.

Great professor! Lectures can be confusing but he is excellent at answering any questions you have either in class or by e-mail. He really listens to the students. Not one of those professors who thinks they are god, he's really down to earth and teaches so that his students will understand. Would definitely recommend!

he seems very nice, but lecture is so boring! goes off topic, mumbles, stutters, stops mid-sentence...just overall a terrible lecturer. sitting through lecture is pretty painful, so i didn't go very often. however the actual material is pretty easy so it can be an easy A if you do your hw&go to discussion.
He is a fantastically sweet guy he just really has a hard time staying on topic and keeping this interesting.

Nice guy, but horrible lecturer! His lectures are completely unorganized, he has no idea how to teach, when he isn't mumbling you can't understand what he's saying anyways, and he is incredibly boring. I doubt I'm the only one to detect the irony of a linguistics professor who can't speak properly. Stay away from this professor!

Interesting class and good lecturer. He differs from the textbook a lot, and the TAs are horrible! But you don't have to go to discussion so you can avoid them. You have to go to lecture and pay attention or you will get lost about what's going on.

The man is all over the board with lectures and will frustrate you to no end. Jumps around with slides and will not post them so you have no idea what happened in lecture later on. Discussion is imperative - the learning you will do in this class takes place with the TAs. Interesting material, but avoid the professor if you can - for your own sake.
He cares about the subject and his students. Lectures are pointless, he adds in useless info. Discussions are a must if you want to do well in class. The TA's defintly do their job and more!

Friendly but, goes through slides too quickly and can be a bit confusing over topics that would be simple...however it is a pretty easy class...discussions are much more important than the actual lecture

Prof. Purnell is an incredibly nice guy - sort of a cross between a teddy-bear and somebody's grandfather. Unfortunately, he is completely incapable of lecturing. Or even making a single coherent sentence. The man just makes no sense when he talks. Asking clarification questions does not help - the answer will leave you even more confused.

I also thought Prof Purnell to be very nice, helpful and interesting.  His lectures are not THAT incomprehensible; if you pay attention and read most of the material, the class isn't that hard.  It was a little hard to catch up with students who'd already taken linguistics, but he is very open to helping students so you should be fine.  Great prof.

I know that many people find Tom to be very here-there-and-everywhere. It doesn't bother me at all, I've always liked his classes. He is very knowledgeable and a very nice person. I learned a lot, especially in his 306 class. I guess he's an "acquired taste", but he's one of my favorite professors.

Lectures were all over the place, and he would go off on tangents left and right without actually explaining anything. Refused to explain clearly when asked a question. Tests were full of trick questions.

Lectures were incomprehensible, but the notes and diagrams were more incomprehensible. Horrible at explaining things. Also, there were a few favorite students who had already taken almost every linguistics course, including some from him, and he was teaching to them instead of those who hadn't, even though there were no prerequisites.  Do not take
has a tendency to obfuscate relatively simple ideas....lectures are somewhat disorganized....another downside...about 70% of the material is Sociolinguistics and the other 30% is Historical....
